Description: Glazed composition figure of a male figure. Figure is naked, shown in kneeling up position used in Egyptian art to represent a figure making an offering, but arms at sides. Shape of wig/hair, conventional for group, with lower edge turned out at shoulder height. Face crudely shown with blob eyes, (right higher than left) small nose and mouth, poorly represented. Breasts modelled and marked in dark glaze, navel indicated by drop-shaped piercing, pubes shown neatly, while legs and feet are crudely modelled with naked buttocks on heels. Proportions are wrong, and body leans forward awkwardly. Pierced at rear for suspension, with simple loop. Glaze off-white, with greenish tinge. Black brown on hair/wig, large circular areas on breasts, and dot to left side of pubic area area. Core not visible.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: First Temple of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AΠ5 (top level of 'bothros' / 'trench with bowls')
Bibliographic references: Webb 1978 / Archaic Greek Faience, Miniature scent bottles and related objects from East Greece, 650-500BC (385)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. II, no. 10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OM.15)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Egypt Exploration Fund (Committee of)
